intro: Asplundia rhodea, commonly known as the Rhododendron-like plant, is a species native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Ericaceae family, which includes many shrubs and evergreen plants. The plant features showy, bell-shaped flowers that are typically pink or white in color. Its leaves are broad and leathery, providing a dense canopy that supports a variety of epiphytic organisms. Asplundia rhodea is often found growing on tree trunks and branches in humid, shaded environments.
